caption:
This photograph depicts a logging scene with numerous logs scattered across a body of water, possibly a lake or river. Versatile in hue and size, the logs are interspersed, some partially submerged, creating a disorganized yet natural mosaic across the water's surface. The background shows dense forest with a variety of trees, primarily coniferous, that extend along the water's edge, reinforcing the setting’s remote and wild character.

There are no visible human activities or machinery, suggesting that the image captures a moment either before or after active logging operations. The lighting suggests it is daylight, possibly midday, as the light appears to cast minimal shadows on the logs, indicating a sun positioned overhead. The atmosphere feels tranquil yet carries a sense of labor and the utilitarian use of natural resources. The image serves as a powerful visual representation of the logging industry’s interaction with natural landscapes.
title: Logs clog shoreline of St. Croix River above Georgia Pacific paper mill.
